    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • menu

        public void menu()
        Show a menu with the possible options that can be chosen by the user. Read an execute the option of the user. If the option is not valid, request it again.

      • addProject

        public void addProject()
        Read an validate the information of the information of a project prints a message that says if it was possible to add this new project

      • manageStages

        public void manageStages(java.lang.String name)
        Request an array of positive values and initialize the dates of the project with the name that was given
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the project

      • culminateCurrentStage

        public void culminateCurrentStage()
        Read the name of a project, and prints a message that says if it was possible to culminate the currentStage

      • registerCapsule

        public void registerCapsule()
        Request the name and the charge of a collaborator and the information about his capsule. Prints a message indicating whether the capsule was successfully added or not.

      • approveCapsule

        public void approveCapsule()
        Request an url of a capsule and prints a message that says if it was possible to approved it.

      • publishCapsule

        public void publishCapsule()
        Request Id adn URL. Prints a message that says if it was possible to publish the capsule with the given url and id.

      • countCapsulesByType

        public void countCapsulesByType()
        This method counts the number of capsules by type and prints the result. The counting is performed by the controller object.

      • viewLearningExperiencesInAProjectStage

        public void viewLearningExperiencesInAProjectStage()
        This method allows the user to view the learning experiences in a specific project stage. The user is prompted to enter the name of the project and the stage. The information is retrieved from the controller object and printed to the console.

      • showProjectsWithTheGreaterNumOfCapsules

        public void showProjectsWithTheGreaterNumOfCapsules()
        This method displays the projects with the greatest number of capsules. The information is retrieved from the controller object and printed to the console.

      • showCapsulesOfACollabByHisName

        public void showCapsulesOfACollabByHisName()
        This method displays ONE capsule of a collaborator by their name. The user is prompted to enter the name of the collaborator. The information is retrieved from the controller object and printed to the console.

      • searchCapsulesByKeyWords

        public void searchCapsulesByKeyWords()
        Searches for capsules that contain the specified keywords. The user is prompted to enter the number of keywords to search for, and then to enter each keyword. The search results are then displayed.

      • validateIntegerInput

        public int validateIntegerInput()
        Reads the input of the user. If the user typed a non integer value, returns -1. Otherwise, returns the input.
        Returns:
        The value that was registered by the user, or -1 if the user didn't type an integer.

      • validatePositiveInt

        public int validatePositiveInt()
        Puts the user in a loop until he types a positive integer
        Returns:
        An positive double

      • validateDoubleInput

        public double validateDoubleInput()
        Reads the input of the user. If the user typed a non double value, returns -1.
        Returns:
        The value that was registered by the user, or -1 if the user didn't type a double.

      • validatePositiveDouble

        public double validatePositiveDouble()
        Puts the user in a loop until he types a positive double
        Returns:
        A positive double

      • requestDate

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar requestDate()
        Puts the user in a loop until he types a valid date.
        Returns:
        Return a valid GregorianCalendar date. A valid day is an integer from [1 to 31]. A valid month is an integer from [1 to 12]. A valid year is an integer greater than 0.
